packages.name: websub
packages.summary: This module contains an implementation of the W3C "WebSub" (https://www.w3.org/TR/websub/) recommendation, which facilitates a push-based content delivery/notification mechanism between publishers and subscribers.

modules.summary: This module contains an implementation of the W3C "WebSub" (https://www.w3.org/TR/websub/) recommendation, which facilitates a push-based content delivery/notification mechanism between publishers and subscribers.

fields.name: topicIdentifier
fields.description: The identifier based on which dispatching should happen for custom subscriber

fields.name: topicHeader
fields.description: The header to consider if required with dispatching for custom services

fields.name: headerResourceMap
fields.description: The mapping between header value and resource details

fields.name: payloadKeyResourceMap
fields.description: The mapping between value for a particular JSON payload key and resource details

fields.name: headerAndPayloadKeyResourceMap
fields.description: The mapping between values for the header and a particular JSON payload key and resource details

records.name: ExtensionConfig
records.description: The extension configuration to introduce custom subscriber services.

fields.name: host
fields.description: The host name/IP of the WebSub Subscriber Service Listener

fields.name: httpServiceSecureSocket
fields.description: The SSL configurations for the WebSub Subscriber Service Listener

fields.name: extensionConfig
fields.description: The extension configuration to introduce custom subscriber services (webhooks)

records.name: SubscriberListenerConfiguration
records.description: Represents the configuration for the WebSub Subscriber Service Listener.

fields.name: path
fields.description: Path of the WebSubSubscriber service

fields.name: subscribeOnStartUp
fields.description: A `boolean` indicating whether a subscription request is expected to be sent on start up

fields.name: target
fields.description:
The `string` resource URL for which discovery will be initiated to identify the hub and topic,
              or a tuple `[hub, topic]` representing a discovered hub and a topic

fields.name: accept
fields.description: The expected media type

fields.name: acceptLanguage
fields.description: The expected language type

fields.name: leaseSeconds
fields.description: The period for which the subscription is expected to be active

fields.name: secret
fields.description: The secret to be used for authenticated content distribution

fields.name: callback
fields.description: The callback to use when registering, if unspecified host:port/path will be used

fields.name: expectIntentVerification
fields.description: A `boolean` indicating whether an intent verification is expected from the hub

fields.name: publisherClientConfig
fields.description: The configuration for the discovery client, to use if a resource URL is specified

fields.name: hubClientConfig
fields.description: The configuration for the hub client used to interact with the discovered/specified hub

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The topic for which the subscription/unsubscription request is sent

fields.name: callback
fields.description: The callback which should be registered/unregistered for the subscription/unsubscription request sent

fields.name: leaseSeconds
fields.description: The lease period for which the subscription is expected to be active

fields.name: secret
fields.description: The secret to be used for authenticated content distribution with this subscription

records.name: SubscriptionChangeRequest
records.description: Record representing a WebSub subscription change request.

fields.name: hub
fields.description: The hub at which the subscription/unsubscription was successful

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The topic for which the subscription/unsubscription was successful

fields.name: response
fields.description: The response from the hub to the subscription/unsubscription request

records.name: SubscriptionChangeResponse
records.description: Record representing subscription/unsubscription details if a subscription/unsubscription request is successful.

fields.name: mode
fields.description: The mode specified in the intent verification request, subscription or unsubscription

fields.name: topic
fields.description: The topic for which intent is verified to subscribe/unsubscribe

fields.name: challenge
fields.description: The challenge to be echoed to verify intent to subscribe/unsubscribe

fields.name: leaseSeconds
fields.description:
The lease seconds period for which a subscription will be active if intent verification
                 is being done for subscription

fields.name: request
fields.description: An `http:Request` received for intent verification

parameters.name: expectedTopic
parameters.description: The topic for which subscription should be accepted

returnParameters.description: An `http:Response`, which to the hub verifying/denying intent to subscribe

methods.name: buildSubscriptionVerificationResponse
methods.description:
Builds the response for the request, verifying intention to subscribe, if the topic matches that expected.
```ballerina
    #  http:Response response = request.buildSubscriptionVerificationResponse("<TOPIC_TO_VERIFY_FOR>");
    # ```

parameters.name: expectedTopic
parameters.description: The topic for which unsubscription should be accepted

returnParameters.description: An `http:Response`, which to for the hub verifying/denying intent to unsubscribe

methods.name: buildUnsubscriptionVerificationResponse
methods.description:
Builds the response for the request, verifying intention to unsubscribe, if the topic matches that expected.
```ballerina
    # http:Response response = request.buildUnsubscriptionVerificationResponse("<TOPIC_TO_VERIFY_FOR>");
    # ```

parameters.name: expectedTopic
parameters.description: The topic for which subscription should be accepted

returnParameters.description: An `http:Response`, which to the hub verifying/denying intent to subscribe

otherMethods.name: buildSubscriptionVerificationResponse
otherMethods.description:
Builds the response for the request, verifying intention to subscribe, if the topic matches that expected.
```ballerina
    #  http:Response response = request.buildSubscriptionVerificationResponse("<TOPIC_TO_VERIFY_FOR>");
    # ```

parameters.name: expectedTopic
parameters.description: The topic for which unsubscription should be accepted

returnParameters.description: An `http:Response`, which to for the hub verifying/denying intent to unsubscribe

otherMethods.name: buildUnsubscriptionVerificationResponse
otherMethods.description:
Builds the response for the request, verifying intention to unsubscribe, if the topic matches that expected.
```ballerina
    # http:Response response = request.buildUnsubscriptionVerificationResponse("<TOPIC_TO_VERIFY_FOR>");
    # ```

classes.name: IntentVerificationRequest
classes.description: representing an intent verification request received.

returnParameters.description: String-constrained array map of the query params

methods.name: getQueryParams
methods.description:
Retrieves the query parameters of the content delivery request as a map.
```ballerina
    # map<string[]> payload = notification.getTextPayload();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The `mime:Entity` of the request or else an `error` if entity construction fails

methods.name: getEntity
methods.description:
Retrieves the `mime:Entity` associated with the content delivery request.
```ballerina
    # mime:Entity|error payload = notification.getEntity();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `true` if the specified header key exists or else `false`

methods.name: hasHeader
methods.description:
Returns whether the requested header key exists in the header map of the content delivery request.
```ballerina
    # boolean payload = notification.hasHeader("name");
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
The first header value for the specified header name or else panic if no header is found. Ideally, the
           `Notification.hasHeader()` needs to be used to check the existence of a header initially.

methods.name: getHeader
methods.description:
Returns the value of the specified header. If the specified header key maps to multiple values, the first of
these values is returned.
```ballerina
    # string payload = notification.getHeader("name");
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
The header values the specified header key maps to or else panic if no header is found. Ideally, the
           `Notification.hasHeader()` needs to be used to check the existence of a header initially.

methods.name: getHeaders
methods.description:
Retrieves all the header values to which the specified header key maps to.
```ballerina
    # string[] headersNames = notification.getHeaders("name");
    # ```

returnParameters.description: An array of all the header names

methods.name: getHeaderNames
methods.description:
Retrieves all the names of the headers present in the content delivery request.
```ballerina
    # string[] headersNames = notification.getHeaderNames();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The `content-type` header value as a `string`

methods.name: getContentType
methods.description:
Retrieves the type of the payload of the content delivery request (i.e: the `content-type` header value).
```ballerina
    # string contentType = notification.getContentType();
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
The `json` payload or else an `error` in case of errors.
           If the content; type is not JSON, an `error` is returned.

methods.name: getJsonPayload
methods.description:
Extracts `json` payload from the content delivery request.
```ballerina
    # json|error payload = notification.getJsonPayload();
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
The `xml` payload or else an `error` in case of errors.
           If the content; type is not XML, an `error` is returned.

methods.name: getXmlPayload
methods.description:
Extracts `xml` payload from the content delivery request.
```ballerina
    # xml|error result = notification.getXmlPayload();
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
The payload as a `text` or else  an `error` in case of errors.
           If the content type is not of type text, an `error` is returned.

methods.name: getTextPayload
methods.description:
Extracts `text` payload from the content delivery request.
```ballerina
    # string|error result = notification.getTextPayload();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: A byte channel from which the message payload can be read or esle an `error` in case of errors

methods.name: getByteChannel
methods.description:
Retrieves the request payload as a `ByteChannel` except in the case of multiparts.
```ballerina
    # io:ReadableByteChannel|error result = notification.getByteChannel();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The message payload as a `byte[]` or else an `error` in case of errors

methods.name: getBinaryPayload
methods.description:
Retrieves the request payload as a `byte[]`.
```ballerina
    # byte[]|error payload = notification.getBinaryPayload();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: The form params as a `map` or else an `error` in case of errors

methods.name: getFormParams
methods.description:
Retrieves the form parameters from the content delivery request as a `map`.
```ballerina
    # map<string>|error result = notification.getFormParams();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: String-constrained array map of the query params

otherMethods.name: getQueryParams
otherMethods.description:
Retrieves the query parameters of the content delivery request as a map.

    # ```

classes.name: Notification
classes.description: Represents the WebSub Content Delivery Request received.

parameters.name: message
parameters.description:
The response or any payload of type `string`, `xml`, `json`, `byte[]`, `io:ReadableByteChannel`,
            or `mime:Entity[]`

returnParameters.description: An `error` on failure or else `()`

remoteMethods.name: respond
remoteMethods.description:
Sends the response to the caller.
```ballerina
    # error? response = caller->respond();
    # ```

parameters.name: message
parameters.description:
The response or any payload of type `string`, `xml`, `json`, `byte[]`, `io:ReadableByteChannel`,
            or `mime:Entity[]`

returnParameters.description: An `error` on failure or else `()`

methods.name: respond
methods.description:
Sends the response to the caller.
```ballerina
    # error? response = caller->respond();
    # ```

clients.name: Caller
clients.description: The caller remote functions to respond to client requests.

returnParameters.description:
The `SubscriptionChangeResponse` indicating subscription details if the request was successful
          or else an `error` if an error occurred with the subscription request

remoteMethods.name: subscribe
remoteMethods.description:
Sends a subscription request to a WebSub Hub.
```ballerina
    # websub:SubscriptionChangeResponse|error response = websubHubClientEP->subscribe(subscriptionRequest);
    # ```

returnParameters.description:
An unsubscription details if the request was successful or else an `error` if an error occurred
           with the unsubscription request

remoteMethods.name: unsubscribe
remoteMethods.description:
Sends an unsubscription request to a WebSub Hub.
```ballerina
    # websub:SubscriptionChangeResponse|error response = websubHubClientEP->unsubscribe(subscriptionRequest);
    # ```

parameters.name: url
parameters.description: The URL at which the subscription should be changed

parameters.name: config
parameters.description: The `http:ClientConfiguration` for the underlying client or `()`

methods.name: init
methods.description: Initializes the `websub:SubscriptionClient`.

returnParameters.description:
The `SubscriptionChangeResponse` indicating subscription details if the request was successful
          or else an `error` if an error occurred with the subscription request

    # ```

           with the unsubscription request

parameters.name: config

clients.name: SubscriptionClient
clients.description: The HTTP based client for WebSub subscription and unsubscription.

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to register the listener

lifeCycleMethods.name: attach
lifeCycleMethods.description:
Binds a service to the `websub:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # error? result = websubListener.attach(helloService);
    # ```

fields.name: config
fields.description: The configurations for the `websub:Listener`

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: The port number of the remote service

methods.name: init
methods.description: Creates a new `websub:Listener`.

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to register the listener

methods.name: attach
methods.description:
Binds a service to the `websub:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # error? result = websubListener.attach(helloService);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to detach the service

methods.name: detach
methods.description:
Stops consuming messages and detaches the service from the `websub:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # error? result = websubListener.detach(helloService);
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to start the listener

methods.name: 'start
methods.description:
Starts the `websub:Listener`.
```ballerina
    # error? result = websubListener.'start();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: gracefulStop
methods.description:
Stops the `websub:Listener` gracefully.
```ballerina
    # error? result = websubListener.gracefulStop();
    # ```

returnParameters.description: () or else an `error` upon failure to stop the listener

methods.name: immediateStop
methods.description:
Stops the `websub:Listener` forcefully.
```ballerina
    # error? result = websubListener.immediateStop();
    # ```

parameters.name: port
parameters.description: The port number of the remote service

returnParameters.description: `()` or else an `error` upon failure to detach the service

    # ```

returnParameters.description: A `(topic, hubs)` if parsing and extraction is successful or else an `error` if not

functions.name: extractTopicAndHubUrls
functions.description: Retrieves hub and topic URLs from the `http:response` from a publisher to a discovery request.

constants.name: PUBLISH_MODE_DIRECT
constants.description:
`RemotePublishMode` indicating direct update content notification (fat-ping). The payload of the update
notification request from the publisher to the hub would include be the update content.

constants.name: PUBLISH_MODE_FETCH
constants.description:
`RemotePublishMode` indicating that once the publisher notifies the hub that an update is available, the hub
needs to fetch the topic URL to identify the update content.

constants.name: SHA1
constants.description: The constant used to represent SHA-1 cryptographic hash algorithm

constants.name: SHA256
constants.description: The constant used to represent SHA-256 cryptographic hash algorithm

constants.name: TOPIC_ID_HEADER
constants.description: `TopicIdentifier` indicating dispatching based solely on a header of the request.

constants.name: TOPIC_ID_HEADER_AND_PAYLOAD
constants.description:
`TopicIdentifier` indicating dispatching based on a combination of header and values specified for a key/key(s) in
the JSON payload of the request.

constants.name: TOPIC_ID_PAYLOAD_KEY
constants.description: `TopicIdentifier` indicating dispatching based solely on a value for a key in the JSON payload of the request.

annotations.name: SpecificSubscriber
annotations.description:
Annotation to declare that the service represents a specific webhook.
Generic WebSub Subscriber service validation is not done for
service variables annotated as `@websub:SpecificSubscriber`.

annotations.name: SubscriberServiceConfig
annotations.description: WebSub Subscriber Configuration for the service, indicating subscription related parameters.

types.name: RemotePublishMode
types.description: The identifier to be used to identify the mode in which update content should be identified.

types.name: SignatureMethod
types.description: The identifier to be used to identify the cryptographic hash algorithm.

types.name: TopicIdentifier
types.description: The identifier to be used to identify the topic for dispatching with custom subscriber services.
